definition: a cut above/top quality
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once
to stir up trouble at every opportunity (idiom)
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
to pander to sb's whims
to bide one's time, waiting for an opportunity to stage a comeback in public life (idiom)
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
Words of benevolence apply universally (idiom). Humanitarian expressions benefit all.
lit. friends for a day (idiom)/fig. casual acquaintance
to judge people based on their success or failure (idiom)
lit. to live on dry provisions and wild herbs (idiom)/fig. to live in abject poverty
lit. to wear one's coat inside out and carry firewood on one's back (idiom)/fig. to live a life of poverty and hard work/fig. to act stupidly
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
fine horse/thoroughbred
expert craft from hard practice (idiom); hard-won skill/A masterpiece demands suffering.
